document.docAuthor: Serrano, Artur R. M. & Capela, Rúben A.
document.masterDocTitle: The tiger beetles (Coleoptera: Carabidae, Cicindelinae) of Angola: a descriptive catalogue and designation of neotypes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The tiger beetles (Coleoptera: Carabidae, Cicindelinae) of Angola: a descriptive catalogue and designation of neotypes

heading.emphasis:
Foveodromica Cassola, 2002
( Mem. Soc. Entomol. It. 81 : 13 )

subSubSection.paragraph:
This genus was created and described by Cassola ( 2002 ) when performed the revision of the
Dromica
genus. It is represented in Angola by 11 species (two of them new to science and under description yet, P. Schüle pers. comm.).

Foveodromica auropunctata (Quedenfeldt, 1883 )
( Berl. Ent. Zeitschr .
27
: 249 )
— Type locality: Malange (=Malanje) (MALANJE) ( 131 ), Holotype ♀, MNHN.
—Benguela (BENGUELA) ( 251 ) (Ferreira 1965 , ibidem).

—Tchivinguire (=Tchivinguiro, Chão da Chela) (HUILA) ( 355 ) (Werner 2000 a). New localities reported: 10 km SW Cacula (HUILA) ( 337 ) (P. Schüle pers. comm.). Remarks. A species collected in Malanje by Major von Mechow for the first time. Later on it was discovered
in other localities of Angola , country from where it seems proper in the central Provinces (north of Huilla and
when pursued will hide under dry leaves like ants, which insects it greatly resembles in its movements”. In Cacula
it was collected during day in open secondary forest (P. Schüle pers. comm.).

Foveodromica bicostulata W. Horn, 1913
[ Arch. Naturg.
79
(A 11 ): 9 ]
— Type locality: Bailundo (HUAMBO) ( 232 ), 1 ♀, SDEI.
New localities reported: 12 km E Cuito (=Silva Porto) (BIÉ) ( 235 ) (P. Schüle pers. comm.). Remarks. An Angolan tiger beetle endemic species. The single holotype female specimen was only known so
an open secondary forest, natural meadows and arable fields (P. Schüle pers. comm.).

Foveodromica grossula (W. Horn, 1913 )
( Arch. Naturgesch .
79
, A 11 : 12 )

— Type locality: Angola (without localities),
2 ♂
, 1 ♀, SDEI.

New localities reported: 75 km N Caconda (near Cuima), 75 km NE Caconda (HUAMBO) ( 280 ); 30 km N Cacula, 3,5 km SW Negola, 10 km W Negola, 20 km S Caluquembe (HUILA) ( 317 ); 10 km SW Cacula, (HUILA) ( 337 ) (P. Schüle pers. comm.).

Remarks. An endemic species of Angola described by Horn ( 1913 ) based on specimens of V. Plason collection, a collector from Vienna (Werner 2000 a). The new localities here reported increases our knowledge on the distribution of this species in Angola . The Caconda region seems to be the core territory of
F. grossula
. The adults are active during day in open secondary forest (P. Schüle pers. comm.).

Foveodromica humeralis (W. Horn, 1913 )
( Rev. Zool. Afr .
2
: 277 )

— Type locality: Bailundo (HUAMBO),
1 ♂
, 1 ♀, SDEI.
—Bailundo (HUAMBO) ( 232 ) (Werner 2000 a).
New localities reported: 12 km E Cuito (=Silva Porto) and 50 km NEE Cuito (near Chissemba Mission) (BIÉ) ( 235 ) (P. Schüle pers. comm.).

Remarks. An endemic tiger beetle species of Angola . Cassola ( 2002 ) refers that apparently only the two type specimens are known so far, but that a male specimen of Werner collection labelled “Bailundo” was figured in his book (Fig.
162 in
Werner 2000 a). The new localities here reported are close to the known “old” ones on the distribution of this species in Angola . Adults were sampled during day in open secondary forest (P. Schüle pers. comm.).

Foveodromica juengeri (Cassola, 1985 )
(
Redia
68
: 33 )

— Type locality: Calulo,
10 º 01´S
,
15 º 05´E
(KWANZA SUL) ( 128 ), 3 ♀, JWC, FCC, MRAC. New localities reported: 19 km S Calulo (KWANZA SUL) ( 147 ) (P. Schüle pers. comm.). Remarks. An endemic tiger beetle species of Angola from which only the type specimens were known so far.
through arable fields (P. Schüle pers. comm.).

Foveodromica marginepunctata (W. Horn, 1908 )
( Not. Leyden Mus .
30
: 32 )

— Type locality: Chiyaka (=Tchiacana?), Kuiva River (BENGUELA) ( 251 ),
6 ♂
, 4 ♀, SDEI. —Ganda (BENGUELA) ( 278 ) [Horn 1935 , sub
Dromica ( Cosmena ) marginepunctata
]. —Ebanga (BENGUELA) ( 254 ) [Horn 1935 ; Monard et al . 1956 ; Ferreira 1965 all sub
Dromica ( Cosmena )

marginepunctata
].

Remarks. An endemic tiger beetle species of Angola discovered by Wellman in 1907 . It is quite impossible to locate precisely the capture site between Cuchi and Menongue given by Cassola ( 1980 ). Wellman & W. Horn ( 1908 ) referred that this species “is even more shade-loving than”
F . auropunctata
and “occurs in enormous numbers in the bush”, exhibiting the same habits of
F . auropunctata
also.

Foveodromica soror (W. Horn, 1935 )
( Stett. Ent. Zeit .
96
: 163 )
— Type locality: Benguela (BENGUELA) ( 251 ), 1 ♀, SDEI. Remarks. An endemic tiger beetle species of Angola from which is known so far only the female type
specimen. No ecological data are known for this species.

Foveodromica strandi (W. Horn, 1913 )
( Arch. Naturgesch .
79
A 11 : 11 )
Remarks. Only the type specimen and another female specimen from Republic Popular of Congo (Shaba, Kawa River) are known so far (Cassola 2002 ). No ecological data are known for this species also.

Foveodromica wellmani (W. Horn, 1908 )
( Not. Leyden Mus .
30
: 31 )

— Type locality: Chiyaka (=Tchiacana?), Kuiva River (BENGUELA) ( 251 ),
4 ♂
, 5 ♀, SDEI.

have the same habits like
F. auropunctata
and
F. marginepunctata
, “which it so closely resembles that it is
impossible to distinguish them in the field and in company with which it usually occurs” (syntopic species).

Apparently this species presents the same distributional pattern of
D. tricostata
. The adults near Caluquembe were
sampled during day in open secondary forest (P. Schüle pers. comm.).
